intro: Lasiolytrum, commonly known as the yellow false shamrock, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a flowering plant that typically grows in moist, woodland areas. The plant features trifoliate leaves with a distinctive yellowish-green coloration. Its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters. Lasiolytrum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in shaded, damp environments.
